1.speaker: PENGUIN
1.japanese: どうしたの　パンダ君　溜息なんかついて
1.english: What's wrong, Panda? Why are you sighing?

2.speaker: PANDA
2.japanese: バイト行きたくないよ
2.english: I don't want to go to work.

4.speaker: PANDA
4.japanese: 本当に何もすることなくて　超退屈なんだもん
4.english: There's nothing to do, so it's really boring.

5.speaker: PANDA
5.japanese: 常勤パンダさんとあっち向いてほいとかしても
5.english: Even when I'm playing "Hey, look over there" with Mr. Full-time Panda,

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: 十五分ぐらい厭きるし
6.english: I get tired of it after fifteen minutes.

7.speaker: PENGUIN
7.japanese: よく十五分もできるね
7.english: I'm surprised you can even play that for fifteen minutes.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.english: I'd be sick of it after fifteen seconds.

9.speaker: PANDA
9.japanese: ペンギンさん　時間潰すのって大変だよ
9.english: It's really hard to kill time, Mr. Penguin.

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: 仕方ないから　いっぱいお昼寝してたら
10.english: I didn't have a choice, so I napped a bunch,

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 寝違えって　首回らなくなっちゃうし
11.english: but I slept wrong and got a stiff neck. Even if I eat my snacks really slowly, only a little bit of time passes.

12.speaker: PANDA
12.japanese: パンダのバイト始めてから　おやつの食べ過ぎで太っちゃった
12.english: Ever since I started my part-time job as a panda, I've been eating too many snacks and put on some weight.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.english: You really think that's the only reason? Yup. I'm gaining weight because I have a job.

16.speaker: POLAR BEAR
16.japanese: パンダ君のバイトって　週二日だよね
16.english: You work at your job twice a week, right? Yup.

17.speaker: PENGUIN
17.japanese: 週二日で文句言わないでよ
17.english: Stop complaining about having to work twice a week.

21.speaker: PANDA
21.english: Maybe I'll make it once a week.

23.speaker: POLAR BEAR
23.japanese: いいな　僕は仕事忙しくて　もう少し暇になりたい
23.english: It must be nice. I'm very busy at work. I'd like a little more free time.

25.speaker: POLAR BEAR
25.japanese: 偶には気分転換したいね
25.english: I'd like to have a change of pace once in a while.

26.speaker: SASAKO
26.japanese: お店忙しいですもんね

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: あ　いいなぁ　忙しいの
27.english: Jeez, it must be nice to be so busy.

28.speaker: POLAR BEAR
28.japanese: パンダ君になってゴロゴロしたい
28.english: I want to be like you, Panda, and just laze around. Come on, you two. You're asking for things you can't have.

29.speaker: PENGUIN
29.japanese: 笹子さん　何か言ってやってよ
29.english: You should say something to them, Miss Sasako.

31.speaker: POLAR BEAR
31.japanese: いい事思いついちゃった
31.english: I just got a great idea.

33.speaker: POLAR BEAR
33.japanese: パンダ君　一日だけ入れ替わってみない？
33.english: Do you want to trade places for a day, Panda? Huh? I'll go to the zoo to work as a panda,

34.speaker: POLAR BEAR
34.japanese: パンダ君は白熊カフェでマスターするの
34.english: and you can manage things here at Polar Bear's Café.

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: いやいや　無理でしょ
35.english: No, no, no, that's a bad idea.

36.speaker: PANDA
36.english: That's a great idea. You're really cool, Polar Bear. I've wanted to be like you just once.

38.speaker: PANDA
38.english: You think so? Stop saying weird stuff, Polar Bear.

39.speaker: HANDA
39.japanese: あ　おはよう　パンダ君

42.speaker: POLAR BEAR
42.japanese: パンダコーナーってこっちだっけ？
42.english: Was this the way to the panda corner?

43.speaker: HANDA
43.japanese: ちょっと待ってよ！白熊君でしょ？
43.english: W-Wait a minute! You're Polar Bear, aren't you? Oh, you can tell?

44.speaker: POLAR BEAR
44.japanese: 半田さん　平気平気

45.speaker: POLAR BEAR
45.japanese: お客さんには熊の区別なんてつかないから
45.english: The visitors can't tell the difference between different bears.

47.speaker: HANDA
47.japanese: 白熊君なの　物分りだよ
47.english: They'll know right away with you, Polar Bear!

49.speaker: KIRINO
49.japanese: 待ってください　先輩

51.speaker: KIRINO
51.japanese: 今日は　常勤パンダさんが有給休暇で休みですよ
51.english: Mr. Full-time Panda is off today on paid leave.

53.speaker: GIRL
53.japanese: ママ　パンダさんいないよ

54.speaker: HANDA
54.japanese: 白熊君　パンダ君は？

57.speaker: POLAR BEAR
57.japanese: 今から呼んでも間に合わないよ
57.english: Even if I called him now, it'd be too late.

58.speaker: POLAR BEAR
58.english: Don't worry. Leave it to me.

59.speaker: HANDA
59.japanese: な…なるべく目立たないように　お願いします
59.english: T-Try not to make yourself too obvious, please.

61.speaker: RINRIN
61.japanese: パンダ君　美味しそうな笹が手に入ったから
61.english: Hey, Panda! I just got some tasty-looking bamboo grass,

62.speaker: RINRIN
62.english: so I thought I'd bring you some—

64.speaker: PENGUIN
64.japanese: 気になって見に来ちゃったよ
64.english: I couldn't stop thinking about it, so I came to look. I'm a panda.

65.speaker: RINRIN
65.japanese: 何だか熱があるみたいだ
65.english: I think I may have a fever.

68.speaker: PENGUIN
68.japanese: やっぱり無理だよ　全然違うよ
68.english: I knew this was a bad idea! He doesn't look anything like a panda!

70.speaker: GUY
70.japanese: 何が違くねぇ？長すぎるっていうか　でか過ぎねぇ？
70.english: Something seems off. He seems too long, or something. Isn't he too big?

71.speaker: GUY2
71.japanese: でも俺ら生パンダ見るの始めてたし
71.english: Well, this is the first time we've seen a panda in person,

72.speaker: GUY2
72.english: so maybe that's what they look like.

74.speaker: GUY
74.japanese: なんかあのシルエットは白熊じゃねぇ？
74.english: isn't that a polar bear's silhouette?

78.speaker: GUY2
78.japanese: ほら　やっぱりパンダだよ

82.speaker: PENGUIN
82.japanese: 白熊君　グッドジョブ

84.speaker: LADY
84.english: Excuse me. Yes, I'll be right there!

85.speaker: POLAR BEAR
85.english: There really is nothing to do at this job.

86.speaker: GUY2
86.japanese: あんまり動かないなぁ

87.speaker: GUY
87.japanese: パンダだもん　仕方ないよ
87.english: That's to be expected, he's a panda.

88.speaker: POLAR BEAR
88.japanese: おっと　サービス　サービス

89.speaker: POLAR BEAR
89.japanese: あれ　タイヤでどうやって遊べばいいんだっけ
89.english: Huh? How exactly do you play with a tire?

91.speaker: GIRL
91.japanese: パンダさんどうしたの

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.japanese: どうしよう　皆怪しんでるよ
92.english: Oh, no! Everyone's becoming suspicious! Um...

93.speaker: GUY
93.japanese: おほ　遊んでる　遊んでる

95.speaker: PENGUIN
95.japanese: もう　白熊君がありえない動きするから
95.english: No! You're making everyone suspicious by doing unthinkable moves!

96.speaker: GUY
96.japanese: 生パンダはやっぱ違うなぁ
96.english: Seeing a panda in person is totally different! Yeah! What?!

98.speaker: POLAR BEAR
98.japanese: よし　もっとサービスしよう
98.english: All right, I'll give them even more service.

99.speaker: GUY
99.english: Whoa! It's a polar bear! Hey.

101.speaker: GUY
101.english: Whoa! It's a polar bear! Hey.

103.speaker: GUY
103.english: Whoa! It's a polar bear! Whoa! It's a panda!

105.speaker: PENGUIN
105.japanese: （パンダ　白熊　パンダ　白熊……）

106.speaker: HANDA
106.japanese: パンダがいないとまずい
106.english: The pandas not being here isn't good.

107.speaker: HANDA
107.japanese: 白熊パンダがばれてもやばすぎる
107.english: I'll be in trouble if people find out that Polar Bear isn't a panda. Maybe I should get an apology letter ready... Mr. Handa, we've got a problem! It's finally happened! They've found out!

108.speaker: KIRINO
108.japanese: パンダ君が大人気ですよ
108.english: Polar Bear panda is a hit! What do I do?! Huh?

110.speaker: GUY
110.japanese: すげぇー　あの距離を沈めたぞ
110.english: Amazing! He made it from that distance!

111.speaker: GUY2
111.japanese: マスタスでられじゃねぇ？
111.english: He could probably enter the Masters!

112.speaker: POLAR BEAR
112.english: Thank you. Thank you. You're so amazing, Mr. Panda!

113.speaker: KIRINO
113.japanese: パンダグッズも飛ぶように売れてます
113.english: The panda merchandise is selling like crazy!

114.speaker: GUY
114.japanese: このパンダティシャツください
114.english: Could I get this panda T-shirt?

115.speaker: LADY
115.japanese: パンダバッグ三色全部
115.english: I'd like all three colors of the panda handbags!

116.speaker: POLAR BEAR
116.japanese: 半田さん　大成功でしょ

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.japanese: そういえば　あっちはどうなったかな
117.english: Now that I think about it, I wonder how it's going on the other end.

120.speaker: MAN
120.japanese: なにしようかな　えっと
120.english: I wonder what I should get. Let's see...

121.speaker: MAN2
121.japanese: いや　その　白熊にしてはちょっと小さいというか
121.english: Aren't you a little short to be a polar bear? Or rather...

123.speaker: PANDA
123.japanese: いいえ　白熊ですよ
123.english: No, I'm Polar Bear. Where did Polar Bear go? I'm right here.

127.speaker: GUY
127.japanese: あれ　今日白熊君は

129.speaker: POLAR BEAR
129.japanese: やってきました　海
129.english: Here we are, the beach! The beach!

130.speaker: PENGUIN
130.english: You've gotta head to the beach in summer.

131.speaker: PANDA
131.japanese: ペンギンさん　どう　このシャツおニュウなんだ
131.english: What do you think, Mr. Penguin? This is a new shirt.

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.japanese: パンダ君　普段何にも着てないのに
132.english: But you don't usually wear clothes, Panda.

133.speaker: PANDA
133.japanese: シーンにあわせた装い
133.english: I wanted to fit in with the setting.

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.english: And what setting would that be?

135.speaker: POLAR BEAR
135.english: Let's get changed and go swimming already. Let's relax a little, Polar Bear.

137.speaker: OLD LADY
137.japanese: ほんまや　海にパンダがいてるわ
137.english: That it is. Imagine that. A panda at the beach.

138.speaker: OLD LADY
138.japanese: アロハ着て　可愛らしいな
138.english: Look at how cute he is in his Hawaiian shirt.

140.speaker: OLD LADY
140.japanese: 飴ちゃ　あげようか

141.speaker: OLD LADY
141.japanese: ほなな　気ィつけてな
141.english: See y'all again! Y'all be careful!

147.speaker: PENGUIN
147.english: He's so popular. If we don't get in soon, it's going to get dark, Polar Bear!

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.japanese: さっきまでゆっくりしようって言ってたのに
148.english: You were just saying you wanted to relax.

149.speaker: PANDA
149.japanese: やっぱり着替えるんだ

150.speaker: PANDA
150.japanese: ペンギンさんこそ　いつも同じで飽きないの
150.english: Don't you get tired of always looking the same, Mr. Penguin?

151.speaker: PENGUIN
151.japanese: パンダ君だっていつもは大体同じじゃない
151.english: You pretty much always look the same, too, Panda.

157.speaker: PENGUIN
157.japanese: せっかく皆で来てるんだからさ
157.english: Since we all came here together,

158.speaker: PENGUIN
158.japanese: 一緒になんかやろうよ

159.speaker: POLAR BEAR
159.japanese: あっちでシーカヤックを貸してくれるらしいよ
159.english: I heard they rent out kayaks over there.

161.speaker: PANDA
161.japanese: 知らないけど　やりたい
161.english: I don't know what it is, but I wanna do it! Horizon as far as the eye can see. This is great!

162.speaker: PENGUIN
162.japanese: 難しいよ白熊君　どうやるの
162.english: This is hard, Polar Bear! How do you do this?

163.speaker: POLAR BEAR
163.japanese: 水面深くまでパドルを入れないで
163.english: Without subermerging the paddle too deeply,

164.speaker: POLAR BEAR
164.japanese: 利き手側のブレード引き押せたら 同時に反対側を押し出す
164.english: you pull with your dominant hand and push with the opposite hand at the same time.

165.speaker: POLAR BEAR
165.japanese: 両肩のラインよりひじが回らないように
165.english: Don't let your elbows break the plane above your shoulders.

166.speaker: POLAR BEAR
166.english: Instead, move your lower back― Could you explain it more simply, please?!

167.speaker: POLAR BEAR
167.japanese: ペンギンさんがいつも泳ぐときみたいに
167.english: Just paddle like you usually swim.

169.speaker: PENGUIN
169.japanese: ね　見た　パンダ君
169.english: Hey, did you see that, Panda? I'm bored with this.

171.speaker: PANDA
171.japanese: 海しか見えないし　動かないよ
171.english: All you can see is the ocean and this thing isn't moving.

172.speaker: PENGUIN
172.japanese: 海に来てるんだし　漕いでないから当たり前じゃない
172.english: Well we're in the ocean and of course it's not moving since you aren't paddling!

173.speaker: POLAR BEAR
173.japanese: こがなくていいやつ　乗る
173.english: Wanna try something you don't have to paddle? What should we do next?

174.speaker: PANDA
174.japanese: やっぱり砂浜でまったりがいいよ
174.english: I wanna laze around on the beach.

175.speaker: PENGUIN
175.english: I'm going to leisurely dry some fish.

176.speaker: POLAR BEAR
176.english: I'm going to play the ukulele.

177.speaker: PANDA
177.japanese: ねえ　僕の体を作ってよ

179.speaker: PANDA
179.japanese: マッチョでね　セクシーな感じがいいな
179.english: I want to look macho and sexy.

180.speaker: PENGUIN
180.japanese: 前に言ってた　逆三角形の足の長いやつ
180.english: Like your previous upside-down triangle body with the long legs?

181.speaker: CREEPY PANDA
181.japanese: 呼ばれて飛び出た　ドリームパンダ
181.english: I've been called, so here I am, the Dream Panda!

182.speaker: PANDA
182.english: Something a little more tough than that,

183.japanese: でもむきむきすぎないの

188.speaker: POLAR BEAR
188.japanese: ごつくてむきむきすぎない
188.english: He's tough, but not too muscular.

192.japanese: もっとかっこいいのがいいな

194.speaker: PANDA
194.english: This is cool, but not what I was thinking of.

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: うん　皆でお祝いしてるし

199.speaker: PENGUIN
199.english: Am I really needed in this?

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.english: I'm not hesitating, it's just... I know where it is even when I'm blindfolded.

206.speaker: POLAR BEAR
206.english: My sense of smell is really good.

210.speaker: POLAR BEAR
210.japanese: パンダ君に目隠しはダメだね
210.english: Apparently blindfolding Panda is a bad idea.

211.speaker: PANDA
211.japanese: 右だよ　ペンギンさん
211.english: To your right, Mr. Penguin! Huh?! How far to the right?!

212.speaker: POLAR BEAR
212.japanese: 上半身を30度右にねじって　僅かに前傾姿勢をとる
212.english: Turn your upper body to the right 30 degrees, and then slightly bend your body forward.

213.speaker: POLAR BEAR
213.japanese: そして　腕を目の高さに当てて…
213.english: Then raise your arms to about eye level...

214.speaker: PENGUIN
214.japanese: もっと簡単に言ってくれる

216.speaker: PANDA
216.japanese: そこだよ　ペンギンさん

218.speaker: POLAR BEAR
218.japanese: ペン子さんにアタックするつもりで
218.english: Imagine you're going after Miss Penko!

219.speaker: PENGUIN
219.english: Miss Penko, um... D-Do you like dried fish, Miss Penko?

221.speaker: PENGUIN
221.japanese: あの　干物が好き　というかペン子さんも　いいえ
221.english: I also love them, but, Miss Penko, I...

223.speaker: PENGUIN
223.japanese: ペン子さん　聞いてくれますか
223.english: Mish Fenko! Will you hear meh out? Mish Fenko! Mish Fenko! Mish Fenko!

224.speaker: POLAR BEAR
224.japanese: ペン子さん　ペン子さん

225.speaker: GUY
225.japanese: ご注文は　お決まりですか

228.speaker: PANDA
228.japanese: じゃあ　普通盛りでいいんです
228.english: Then a normal serving is just fine.

229.speaker: GUY
229.japanese: すみません　どっちもありません
229.english: I'm sorry, we don't have either.

230.speaker: PANDA
230.japanese: 海の家名物　竹大盛り
230.english: Beach house special: large serving of bamboo.

232.speaker: PENGUIN
232.japanese: パンダ君にだけでしょ

233.speaker: POLAR BEAR
233.japanese: 僕　このサーモンの軽いスモーク ミキュイ　ソース　クレソニエール
233.english: I'll have the lightly smoked salmon mie cuit with sauce cressonnière.

235.speaker: PANDA
235.japanese: じゃあ　僕もトッピング竹で
235.english: I'll have that, too, with bamboo topping.

236.speaker: PENGUIN
236.japanese: ないから　そのトッピング

237.speaker: POLAR BEAR
237.english: What about you, Mr. Penguin? Huh? I'll have the seafood ramen.

238.speaker: PENGUIN
238.japanese: あつっ　あつあつあつ

239.speaker: PANDA
239.japanese: ペンギンさんいつも生魚だもんね
239.english: Mr. Penguin does always eat raw fish.

242.speaker: POLAR BEAR
242.english: The penguin version of a cat's tongue. Saying I have a cat's tongue would be fine!

243.speaker: POLAR BEAR
243.japanese: 頑張って シーフードがペンギンさんを待ってるよ
243.english: You can do it. The seafood is waiting for you, Mr. Penguin. You should eat seafood in the ocean.

244.speaker: PENGUIN
244.japanese: もっともなこと言わないでくれる
244.english: Could you not state the obvious? Hey, that's bad manners.

245.speaker: PENGUIN
245.japanese: 女の子に嫌われちゃうよ
245.english: Girls won't like you. See? Huh?

246.speaker: GIRL
246.japanese: パンダさんが焼き蕎麦食べてる

249.speaker: PANDA
249.japanese: シーンに合わせたふるまい
249.english: Because I'm one with the setting.

250.speaker: PENGUIN
250.japanese: 僕だってラーメン食べてるのに

251.speaker: GUY
251.japanese: ペンギンがラーメン食べてる
251.english: Whoa! That penguin is eating ramen!

252.speaker: GUY2
252.english: What's up with that? So weird!

256.speaker: PENGUIN
256.japanese: やっぱりおいしく感じるシーンっていうのがあるのかもね
256.english: Maybe there's a setting that makes things delicious.

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.japanese: 皆と一緒に風を感じながら
257.english: Sitting here with everyone, feeling the wind...

258.speaker: PENGUIN
258.english: Huh? Let's eat some shaved ice next.

259.speaker: PANDA
259.japanese: 僕　イチゴ味がいいな

260.speaker: PENGUIN
260.japanese: せっかくいいこと言ったのに
260.english: I was saying something really good!

261.speaker: PENGUIN
261.japanese: もう　皆ばらばらだよ
261.english: Jeez, we all got different things.

262.speaker: PENGUIN
262.japanese: ホント自分勝手っていうか　チームワークがないっていうか
262.english: Everyone's so selfish. No teamwork whatsoever.

265.speaker: PENGUIN
265.japanese: そうだね　干物も作れたし
265.english: It was. And I was able to make dried fish.

267.speaker: VOICE
267.japanese: 本日の列車は運行を終了しました
267.english: This ends our daily train schedule.

269.speaker: POLAR BEAR
269.english: The mountains are a great place, too.

272.speaker: PANDA
272.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

274.speaker: PANDA
274.japanese: 本当に興味がない相手と喋る時って話題が思いつかないもんだね
274.english: It's hard to think of something fun to talk about when you're talking to someone you're not interested in.

275.speaker: PENGUIN
275.japanese: それ僕に発表しないでくれる
275.english: Could you not announce that to me?

276.speaker: PANDA
276.japanese: じゃ 得意な白熊君の物まね見せてよ
276.english: Then show me one of your best impersonations of Polar Bear. What?!

277.speaker: PENGUIN
277.english: Next time on Polar Bear's Café—

278.speaker: PANDA
278.english: Let's end this, Polar Bear. What?!

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
